de.rincewind.api.gui.elements

Interface ElementMultiButton

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, ElementButton, ElementDisplayable, ElementSizeable, EventBased, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>, Selectable, Sizeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CraftElementMultiButton

    public interface ElementMultiButton
extends ElementButton, Selectable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>
    In this button, you can run multiple action on one button. On left-clicking this button, this element will be 'selected'. In the lore will be displayed all actions you are able to run. By an second left-click the selected line will be executed. On a right-click, you can scroll through the lore, to select the action you want to run. When an action is executed the MultiButtonPressEvent will be called.
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    Rincewind34

    • Method Detail

      • next

        java.lang.String next()
        Selects the next added entry in the lore. If the currently selected entry is the last one in the lore, the first entry will be selected.
        Returns:
        the new selected entry

      • back

        java.lang.String back()
        Selects the added entry before the currently selected in the lore. If the currently selected entry is the first one in the lore, the last entry will be selected.
        Returns:
        the new selected entry

      • getSwitch

        java.lang.String getSwitch()
        Returns the currently selected entry.
        Returns:
        the currently selected entry

      • setSwitchId

        void setSwitchId(int index)
        Sets the selected index of the entrylist. If the new index is equals or greater than the size of the added entries the index will be set to 0.
        Parameters:
        index - change to

      • addSwitch

        void addSwitch(java.lang.String entry)
        Adds an entry to the list.
        Parameters:
        entry - adding to the list

      • removeSwitch

        Removes an entry from the list.
        Parameters:
        entry - removing from the list.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears the entrylist of this element.

        Returns the count of the added entries.
        Returns:

        int getSwitchId()

        Returns:
        the currently selected index from the list

      • setDefaultFormat

        void setDefaultFormat(java.lang.String str)
        Sets the format witch is important for the regular lines in the lore. The first '%s' will be replaced with the raw entry. The default format is '§f%s' (ElementDefaults.MULTI_BUTTON_DEFAULT_FORMAT).
        Parameters:
        str - change the format to
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the format is null

      • setSelectFormat

        void setSelectFormat(java.lang.String str)
        Sets the format witch is important for the selected line in the lore. The first '%s' will be replaced with the raw entry. The default format is '§d%s' (ElementDefaults.MULTI_BUTTON_SELECTED_FORMAT).
        Parameters:
        str - change the format to
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the format is null

      • setSelectModifier

        void setSelectModifier(ItemModifier modifier)
        Sets the item modifier, witch modifies the icon to make visible, that the button is selected. By the default value, the button will be enchanted.
        Parameters:
        modifier - to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the modifier is null

      • modify

        org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack modify(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack item)
        Modifies an item like the button, when it gets selected.
        Parameters:
        item - to modify
        Returns:
        the modified item
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the item is null
